Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and peaceful downtown accommodation.”
Reviews.Author: Canadiantraveler8888
Reviews.Content: The TCC Hotel is my go to spot in downtown Vancouver. it is very quiet, professional and intimate. You feel like you are a member of the club. Their prices are very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Posh, Very comfortable, Private. Quiet”
Reviews.Author: travelbugberni
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel before and loved it. It is very quiet and private. The suites are wonderfully huge and comfortable, with a separate bedroom and sitting area. Beds are so comfy. The views were awesome!!! There is a little kitchenette in the suites. It is also conveniently located and within a short walk to Robson and Granville Streets and all the diverse restaurants. Love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Terminal City Hub - glossy pics but ...”
Reviews.Author: Jixx
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Terminal City Hub in Feb 2012, and found the staff friendly and my room clean and modern, not as nice as the pictures however, in fact I was bit surprised at how small my room was, but it was all updated. The bar was smaller than I imagined also and rather pricey but not so much for being downtown. It was packed the night I was there but I found a place to sit with a couple of my colleagues. The gym, pool, and hot tub and sauna were top shelf however and I enjoyed my workouts there. The breakfast was good, again pricey but good quality, prices do include a 15% service charge that I am totally against, I think tipping should remain in the interest of the customer and not demanded by the resturaunt. There are many good places to eat around this area. I would stay there again, I would recommend it to friends or family but until they remove the 15% service charge, I am staying away from the bar and the resturaunt.

Reviews.Title: “Prestige of Private Club with Full Guest Access”
Reviews.Author: Gary S
Reviews.Content: I am on record as their first client fromOntario when this hotel facility first opened. It was and still is my favorite downtown Vancouver hotel. All rooms are modern and suite oriented. The views from any room are great, however, Vancouver's high rise developments are starting to block some of the waterfront vistas and Grouse Mountain. The hotel has excellent dining options, with varied menus, tasty food, unbelievably good service and the prices are very good. The ambience throughout this "club property" is quietly sedate but with much happening.

Reviews.Title: “Accomodating and luxurious”
Reviews.Author: CarolynHa
Reviews.Content: We had booked two rooms at this hotel through booking.com and due to tariff changes had changed the booking, but when we arrived the hotel staff could not find any record of our new booking. The front desk staff person was more than helpful in rearranging things so we could stay as booked and also get two rooms on the same floor. She even upgraded my husband and myself to a larger suite with sea views - very nice. I recommend this hotel for its staff and facilities. The rooms were clean and spacious and staff on front desk very helpful. Underground parking was good, but it's a like rabbit warren getting from the parking to the hotel foyer. The location is a bit away from main shopping district - it was rainy when we were there and a 10 minute walk in the rain isn't so pleasant - but on a fine day there would be no issue. It overlooks Canada Place and I'd have enjoyed exploring a bit more if the weather had been better. I would go back again and stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and rooms”
Reviews.Author: k0ke
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location for train travellers. It is a very short walk from Vancouver's Waterfront Station, easy doable even with a lot of luggage. We booked a one night stay at short notice and this turned out to be a lovely two-room suite with kitchenette - microwave and fridge included. Both rooms were large and attractively furnished, extremely clean. The bathroom was massive and nicely appointed. Not sure about the age of this hotel but the rooms seem very new. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “"Second to none!"”
Reviews.Author: Marti G
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three days at the hotel over the holidays and we'll undoubtedly be back! Our suite was spacious with amazing harbour and mountain views, lots of windows, fabulous staff and excellent room service. I particularly enjoyed the silverware service with our breakfast in our suite. As hotel guests we appreciated the use of the pool and sports facilities and as everywhere within this hotel, excellent staff. We had intended on renting a car, however we re-thought that as the location is central and we walked most places. This hotel is rich in Vancouver history, art, and character...... equalled with superb, efficient, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “A lesser known spot in Vancouver, but well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: robfromVancouver
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here 4 nights over the Christmas holidays. I am from Vancouver, but was back visiting and after needing some quiet time after staying with family - I checking in here for a few nights. I had room 1211 - great views of Burrard Inlet and the North Shore mountains. Service is excellent, room service is very prompt and the front desk staff are exception, with special mention to Bunny. Rooms are very spacious and well appointed with VoIP phones and they don't charge for local calls and wireless internet is free (could cost up to $20 a day in other hotels in the area) so this is a good deal. You also have access to the Club's gym, pool and restaurants. I only used the gym but it is very well appointed with a very friendly attendant to help out where needed. The one point is parking is $36 per day, with in and out privileges, so if you are staying for more than a couple days it can get very pricey, particularly if you aren't using your car very much. The hotel is very central in Vancouver for tourist stuff or business travel, restaurants and Canada Line is within a block if you are taking it from the airport - so very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “We'd stay again”
Reviews.Author: CathyLen
Reviews.Content: This is the second time my wife and I have stayed at the TCC hotel. We like the location and the convenience. The staff are great. Restaurants and fitness facilities very good as well. Rooms are small but clean and quiet, which is what we want. The kitchenette and microwave we could take or leave, but we're happy to have the kettle for tea -- most places just have the coffeemaker. Our only complaint would be the bizarre elevator system, a result of the club/office/hotel structure. We also wouldn't want to try to get out of the parking garage -- $36 per night -- in a hurry if there was an event at the club letting out at the same time, or around close of business for the offices.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful suite”
Reviews.Author: Mlou S
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay a The Hotel at Terminal City Club. I stayed in suite 1208 with a beautiful city view. It was perfect for my stay as I had visitors and there was plenty of sitting space. The Kitchenette was a real treat as I could make my coffee and tea at my leisure and was able to keep cream and snacks in the refridgerator. The staff was always friendly and very helpful and the club gym was second to none. I also enjoyed two of the restaurants on the property while I was there and was pleased with both of my selections. I would return in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: havetoloveit
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Harbour King Suite from Dec 17-20,2011. The hotel is lovely, well located, the beds are so comfortable and the suite overlooked the harbour with a beautiful view. Washroom was on the small side but very nice Would definitely recommend it. .

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with high rates”
Reviews.Author: Oneortwoweeks
Reviews.Content: Hotel itself is in one the best locations downtown but that's about all I enjoyed. Nice but not very inviting lobby. They were friendly at reception and helpful at early check-in. But the rooms were below average. Clean but very dated. Bathroom dated. Spa club not very accessible. And they charged extra for adults over double occupancy even when we booked a two room suite. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not used to fancy hotels so this was a real treat!”
Reviews.Author: welikeroadtrips
Reviews.Content: I hadn't stayed in a "fancy" hotel before so wowwww, this was pretty amazing! The food I ordered from room service was so good and the three different rooms I stayed in over the course of a couple months were all huge and had beautiful views. The staff were always so friendly! Really great location too, close to so many things. The only thing I'd say I didn't really care for, which doesn't matter because I didn't use it much, was the continental breakfast - definitely not worth 17 bucks! Oh and also sometimes it got noisy on the street and I had to sadly close my window at night. Otherwise it was a great home away from home for the few weeks I spent in Vancouver this past spring.

Reviews.Title: “New favourite Canadian hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Greenfinch48
Reviews.Content: What a great find! We only had two nights in Vancouver at the beginning and end of a trip to Vancouver Island and Seattle. And this hotel only had availability on one of those nights, unfortunately. But what a fabulous place! Great location close to the waterfront, excellent service and a superb suite on 10th floor (we were fortunate enough to be upgraded) with views to water. Guests also benefit from the facilities of the adjoining Terminal City Club including a huge (25m) swimming pool, which I had virtually to myself, plus spa and fitness centre tho' sadly we didn't have time to put these to the test. Had we known how good this hotel was, we would have skipped our time in Victoria and the much trumpeted but overrated (in our view) Fairmont Empress in favour of the sleek sophistication and more personal service here. Just one reason to withhold that 5th star and that is the very early closing time (to English visitors, at least) of its restaurants. By the time of our arrival at 9 o'clock, the only dining option was the "English-style pub" - great fish and chips but noisy and informal and not quite what we had envisaged for our last night in Canada at this otherwise superlative hotel. One last plaudit for guest services: an item we left in the room has been very efficiently located and mailed back to us. This is (sad reflection perhaps) exceptional in our experience.

Reviews.Title: “No walk in showers”
Reviews.Author: Zinger404
Reviews.Content: No ADA rooms!!!Need a new wheel chair, takes to many elevators to get to the grill!!!!

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel in a lovely vancouver location”
Reviews.Author: wellknoxy
Reviews.Content: Got the skytrain from vancouver airport,got off at the waterfront station. Come out of the station, gastown to your left, the terminal club just up to the right. Hotel staff very friendly and showed me around the hotel and gave me a rundown on the dress code policy for certain areas of the hotel . Hotel room very nice and comfortable. Bed was very cosy. Room came with a kitchenette complete with coffee maker . Every morning staff brought free water and chocolates to the room which was very nice. The leisure centre for me was top class. Played squash every morning and lovely gym and indoor swimming pool with jacuzzi. Shaving cream,razor blades,after shave balm etc free so this was very appreciated. Hotel very well located, near canada place where i got the hop on off tour of the city and the seabus terminal which brings you across to the north island to go to grouse mountain and capilano suspension bridge. Stanley park is a fifteen minute walk from the hotel.(come out of the hotel and turn right and keep walking). The Lion bar is part of this hotel too which has great food and drink. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely consider this one.”
Reviews.Author: club_c
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable facilities. Especially appreciated the free upgrade to a suite. Parking is not included which was a minor irritant @ an additional $37. Excellent central location for exploring downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with great service but more for a man”
Reviews.Author: Heidi S
Reviews.Content: Great customer service! But a few things as women traveller were missing from the hotel. I found the lighting in the bathroom insufficient, the hair dryer was tiny and under powered, the amenities were manly smelling (but very nice) and the sheets were not soft (but clean and still very nice). Overall the hotel was very nice just a few little things...

Reviews.Title: “I loved everything about it. I'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: scovelg
Reviews.Content: I have stayed 4 times in the last month and will be back as often as my business will allow. It is such a pleasure going to a sparkling clean, tastefully decorated, spacious room at the end of busy day. The rooms have grand views of downtown Vancouver and the waterfront. I couldn't help but pull the drapes back and snap a few pictures. Room service was very quick and my food was brought by friendly and very helpful waiters. The food was A+ too. Having lunch on the balcony of the cafe was especially delightful . If you have an occasion to stay at the Terminal City Club you will most definately treasure the experience. Sincerely, Terminally in love with Vancouver Gail Scovel

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Easytravels53449
Reviews.Content: This hotel has very nice rooms. The one I stayed in was tiny, but it had a flat panel TV and window seat in place of a couch and standard TV armoire. Because it is part of the Terminal City Club, you have access to the club amenities. There are at least two restaurants in the hotel and club, at least one of which has a balcony for outdoor dining. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. The only negative is that the hallways leading to the rooms are very narrow and maze-like. But if you don't mind that, this hotel is good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, quiet, location”
Reviews.Author: rogerjm
Reviews.Content: Second time here. Stayed 4 days with another couple. The two room suites are well appointed and modern. The location, next to Canada Place and in central Vancouver can not be beat. The views to Grouse Mountain and the bay are wonderful, especially in the morning and evening. The front desk staff are most helpful. The pool and exercise area are first rate. This is a wonderful hotel in the heart of a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you are booking a cruise to Alaska - great location and service”
Reviews.Author: aztocalifornia
Reviews.Content: We found this small boutique hotel through comments on the trip advisor and cruise critic and booked one night prior to our cruise to Alaska. We booked direct through the hotel and paid $229 for a lovey room with views of the city and very plush and comfortable bedding and decor. Instead of taking a $60 plus tip cab from the airport and sitting in rush hour traffic at 5 PM, we took the sky train from the airport. It was located right across the way from the baggage and was only $8.75 pp and took us about 30 minutes and very few stops. We had 3 bags with wheels and a backpack and it was not too difficult to manuever them as we were about 2 blocks from the cruise ship terminal and 2 blocks from the subway station. The lobby desk people were very welcoming and suggested restaurants and their restaurant in the hotel, where llive music was playing and they had a buffet, but we chose our favorite which was only a $5 5 minute cab drive away. The hotel was quiet and set up as an apartment or business type facilitiy and we liked the personal attention rather than a busy tourist hotel with long lines. Last summer we stayed in the Westin Bayshore and found it to be busy and crowded with lots of tourists and buses and we prefer this one. We definitely would recommend them. They have a large indoor pool too and we did not have time to use it. There were several restaurants nearby..

Reviews.Title: “Lucky us!”
Reviews.Author: tropicalia
Reviews.Content: A mistake by our travel agent rerouted us to the Terminal City Club Hotel. Luck for us! This hotel is excellent in a terrific location. Our room was a spacious suite, very nice view, beautifully decorated. Being part of a private club gives the premises a welcome elegant and refined air. However, it is the service we received from the staff that sets this hotel apart. If I were hiring I would steal Jessica at the front desk, she is exceptional, as is Samantha. Do not miss a dinner at 1892, their restaurant if you want an elegant and unforgetable meal.

Reviews.Title: “Very interesting...”
Reviews.Author: raylee11
Reviews.Content: Hotel was arranged for me for business trip. Great location downtown...waterfront one way in 2 min and Robson 10 min the other way. Lobby looks like typical office building. Room very nice, comfy. Found some butterscotch chips on the floor by window? Nice Irish pub downstairs. Had breakfast at The Grill...typical hotel morning meals at high cost. Friend had dinner there one night and was not impressed. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Pantaleia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with a group of friends to attend a wedding in Vancouver. The first night I was the first of the group to arrive. Being jet-lagged, I wanted to go to bed immediately, only to find out that the sheets on the fold-out bed/sofa had not been changed! I called reception to ask them to send someone to change the linen and they said ok. Then, 10 min later I had a phone call from reception investigating WHY I wanted the sheets changed. I had to explain in detail what I could see on those sheets... Then another 10 minutes later they send someone to INSPECT the bed and only after that did they send someone to change the linen. This was a pretty unpleasant beginning of my stay at this hotel... Other than that the rooms seem to be clean, the beds are comfortable, the view of the harbor is beautiful. The breakfast at the hotel is expensive and not particularly rich: they have boiled eggs, several types of fruit and 3-4 types of cheese, as well as some muffins and bread. The best thing about this hotel is probably its location.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn003
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the terminal city hotel for almost 4 weeks over the period of 2 months. The hotel staff were more than accomodating and incredibly friendly. I found it easy to relax and get a great sleep in my room. As an added bonus, I loved the Purdy's chocolate that were left in my room each day.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile.”
Reviews.Author: Davemcnally
Reviews.Content: Exellent place to stay not one negative thing to say about the staff. But the pool being closed on the weekend and not having pool cards for every room are the only bad things I could say. Bunny he's the best.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: ldldrl
Reviews.Content: The service provided by the Terminal City Club was greatly appreciated. Everyone was very helpful and accommodating. We were there for an extended period of time and the staff made us feel very welcome. The suites are great with all the comforts of home.

Reviews.Title: “When I come back to Vancouver, this is where I will stay.”
Reviews.Author: ICZ59
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for a four-month period on business and all I can say is WOW! The staff were fantastic - friendly, helpful, efficient, professional and always ready to help you out. Anything you needed, it was there for you. All of our business and personal needs were met, and then some. The rooms were also.... fantastic! A great deal in downtown Vancouver and suites as well. Comfortable, spacious, extremely clean. The location could not be better, right across the street from Canada Place and only a couple blocks from the Olympic torch. Right in the center of it all. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel and the staff. You'll have to stay there for yourself to see what I mean!

Reviews.Title: “My daughter & family had a terrific overnight in the City”
Reviews.Author: RObinA76_11
Reviews.Content: Dinner at the grill for a family of four was reasonably priced and the menu awsome. Father and 14 yr old son went to Canuck's game main reason for trip Mother and 12 yr old had a good time swimming in the pool

Reviews.Title: “Great place to vacation for a short trip without air travel to see our city”
Reviews.Author: wood-123
Reviews.Content: We have stayed several times and always had a great time enjoy the food with room service. The location is great to go to local events in all downtown locations with only a short cab ride or in most cases walk to the event with new drinking laws it can cost almost as much to take a cab as the cost of the room depending are where you live in the lowermainland.We have had freinds join us serverl times as well and they have found the experiance positive as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient full service hotel”
Reviews.Author: sab31
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the business district of Vancouver. The location made it very convenient to walk to and from all business meetings. The amenities in the hotel were excellent and the staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “What a great way to start off the new year!”
Reviews.Author: JasonMackay
Reviews.Content: I wanted to start 2011 off right.. After an amazing night of New Years Eve celebrating I was looking to spend the first day of 2011 being pampered in a luxurious hotel with a great view, delicious food and a knowledgeable staff. I chose the right hotel! The Terminal City Club Hotel was perfect. Central location, gorgeous decor in the room and the view of the water and mountains put my hung over mind at ease :) I highly recommended this hotel. Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: g1g1g1
Reviews.Content: I have previously stayed at the Terminal City Club on several occasions and enjoyed the hotel. Unfortunately, my most recent stay was terrible, and it will be my last visit to that hotel. My family stayed for 4 days at the beginning of January 2011. The hotel was understaffed for the holidays, and should probably have been closed. We paid full price despite the hotel appearing to be on skeleton staff, and were not told that there would be any service difficulties when we booked. There was no parking attendant, so while paying $25 per day for parking, guests were required to phone the front desk, then wait on the street while someone was sent to open the parkade security gate to enter. Despite being expensive, the restaurant was a disaster. During our first meal we got to listen to a club member angrily complain to the wait staff about how a rotton meal has caused his son to become ill. That night our own meals were edible, but some of the entrees appeared to have been frozen and heated up in a microwave. The following night, the restaurant served us a chicken club sandwich with chicken so old that the edges had turned grey and hard. Three of the four meals served to us that night were inedible. When I complained to the shift supervisor, she decided not to charge us for our meal, which was appropriate considering we did not eat it. I hope my experience was an anomaly, and that they work out their kitchen and staffing problems. I had been happy with the hotel in the past, but the last visit was bad enough that I will not return.

Reviews.Title: “An elegant establishment.”
Reviews.Author: ogilvie444
Reviews.Content: I adore this hotel. The service is outstanding. I have been a guest 4 times over the past couple of years and have enjoyed an upgrade to a suite every time. The decor is luxurious and the rooms are very comfortable. I feel like royalty each time I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: sblinco
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here over Christmas, after securing a good deal on TripAdvisor. We were super impressed by our large room, terrific service, delicious food from the restaurant... everything. The location is brilliant - walking distance to everything in the city including fantastic restaurants, coffee shops, harbour, ferries, trains and shopping. Our experience here was amazing, despite the weather being awful (although don't let that stop you - Vancouver is a lovely city!). Two thumbs up, give this place a go.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but some disappointments”
Reviews.Author: Lupinfairy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights while my husband was on a conference. Previous reviews had said that the rooms were nice and the beds were comfortable. We found the room was very nice. We had a junior suite and it very well designed with a sitting room, microwave, fridge and coffee maker. Internet WiFi was free. Unfortunately we found the bed to be very uncomfortable and the pillows were overstuffed synthetic pillows. We requested softer pillows and some feather pillows were quickly delivered. They absolutely stank. They smelt like wet feathers but were dry. The smell was so bad that it woke me several times during the night. On the last day the room was free from 9.30am and when I returned to the room at 3pm it had still not been serviced. It was done soon after but was somewhat surprising as the hotel did not seem that busy. Also newspaper delivery was not every day.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every dollar”
Reviews.Author: PortofSpainVirgoLady
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights before departing on a cruise and another when we returned. We found the hotel on Trip Advisor and read the reviews. It was very easy to get to from the airport - the last stop as indicated on the website. The service was excellent. The rooms were very, very clean and neat and made us feel welcome. We were also able to use the gym while we were there. Sheila who works at The Grill was fantastic and took care of our needs. When we checked out to depart on our cruise, the bellman walked us to the cruise terminal and dropped our bags off at the check in point. When we returned from the cruise, we were extended the same very high service standards. We were even given a room four floors higher with an even better view. The hotel is quiet although it is located in a busy area. It is close to shopping and restaurants as well. It was worth every dollar and my husband and I were blown away with every aspect of our stay. We will definitely stay there again should the opportunity present itself and highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Casalin
Reviews.Content: For a modest price by city hotel standards we had an outstanding elegent suite.Meals were very good. Service is understated, but excellent as befits a more club -type atmoshere.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay prior to Alaska cruise”
Reviews.Author: JudyOxford_England
Reviews.Content: Well located for cruise ship terminal and Canada line train from airport- within easy walking distance of both. Can also walk from hotel around seawall and hire bikes for touring around Stanley island. Nice and helpful staff. Attractive, good size room- we had a queen and a sitting room with a sofa bed which accomodated the three of us really well. A good pre-cruise choice. The bellhop with even take your bags over to the cruise terminal ( 5-10 minute walk away).

Reviews.Title: “Ideally situated luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: nesbitevans
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a week at this hotel. I was attending a conference at the Vancouver Convention Centre and the Terminal City Club is right on its doorstep. I managed to get a good rate through Expedia. The location couldn;t have been better. It was a very short walk to the conference but also to many other places and I think was the perfect choice of location. My room (806) was a deluxe double with city view but in fact I could just about see the harbour. The room was spacious, with good amenities. I liked having the fridge and microwave but it did seem a bit silly to have to ask for cutlery and crockery and even then they only brought my one plate, a teeny-tiny bowl, a knife, fork and spoon. The water and ice delivery in the evenings was a great idea. The bed was very comfortable indeed and I slept very well. There are only 12 rooms on each floor so not much noise. Free wi-fi was definitely a bonus. I also liked the bathroom supplies which were high quality. My bathroom was a little small but fully functional. Despite advertising in the rooms that the hotel is environmentally aware and setting out in detail what to expect from the point of view of towel and bedding changes, they still changed the towels every day apart from one. This does annoy me. If a hotel is going to have an environmental policy, then at least stick to it. Thefront desk staff were nice enough if not overly friendly. Simon in the 1892 bar was very friendly indeed. I used the bar on a few occasions and entertained some colleagues there a couple of times. There was a good choice of wines and a sophisticated atmosphere. I did not eat at the hotel. The leisure facilities are fantastic. To the people above who say the entrance is not clear and that the front desk is up some stairs, then perhaps they were at a different hotel to me. The hotel is quite clearly marked, as is the front desk which is up 5 steps from the main lobby. Beside the steps is an obvious ramp for those worried about luggage. My only minor grumbles - I would have liked cutlery & crockery to take more advantage of the small kitchenette area, a mini-bar would have been nice especially as 1892 is only open 5 nights a week and closes at 10. In-room service also finished quite early. Not that I eat and drink a lot but I was on a completely different time zone for the first few days and wide awake until into the small hours. I would definitely recommend this place and stay here again. I have agonised over the scoring and ultimately decided on 4 out of 5 but in reality, it is more like 4.5 out of 5

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary luxury with great views”
Reviews.Author: AllisonTuck
Reviews.Content: This is a luxurious hotel with warm and friendly staff. The Terminal City is situated right in a cosmopolitan harbour area where the cruise ships dock and is close to all amenities. It has superb views overlooking the bay as well as the city - particularly stunning during sunset. There are plenty of great restaurants and high end shops close by and it's only a 5-10 minute walk to the main central shopping area. The hotel has a modern elegance with clean lines and tasteful furnishings giving a feeling of airiness and contemporary luxury. The reception staff and bell hop are all very helpful and make sure you want for nothing. There is a huge secure car park underneath the hotel which is slightly difficult to find when you first drive to the hotel. Although a little pricey, there are some excellent dining options within the hotel including a fabulous wine bar, a grill with outdoor eating area and a very opulent fine dining restaurant. The leisure facilities are second to none, including the incredible pool which is 25 metres and has breathtaking views of Stanley Park, the harbour and mountains! there's a large whirlpool next to the pool and luxurious changing facilities. There's a well equipped gym and even 3 squash courts! It really is great. Our room was on the 12th floor with great views of the bay. It was clean, spacious, had a well equipped kitchen, all mod cons, huge flat screen TV etc. There was a large comfortable bed and the bathroom was large and spotless. Overall you were really well catered for with lots of little extras like complimentary fruit, papers, robes, sparkling water, chocolates etc. I've stayed in other Vancouver hotels previously, but the Terminal City was the ideal choice to spend our final few nights in Canada and I would definitely stay here again when I return. This place was superb!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located but impersonal”
Reviews.Author: Lewis_England_9
Reviews.Content: It maybe because it was late evening when we checked in but the reception and booking although efficient wan not really welcoming. Its like checking in at the front desk of an office building and then staying in a room within an office suite. Good views from our window of downtown vancouver. A pricey and characterless stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, functional, but a little weird....”
Reviews.Author: AW51
Reviews.Content: This isn't a traditional hotel. It's located in a building with some kind of private club, and offices, and residences, and.... It's hard to find it when you arrive, you park in the parking garage and have to tote your bags down a long concrete hallway, the food service and bar(s) seem out of the mainstream to the place and more focused on special events that day-to-day travelers and it just didn't have a warm feeling. Having said that, the location is good and the room was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great start to our holiday”
Reviews.Author: Tigger103
Reviews.Content: The hotel at Terminal City club was our first hotel on a 3 week holiday to Canada and Alaska. It is situated very close to Canada Place so makes a good place to stay if joining a cruise ship (as we were) We booked a deluxe room - it was good but not perhaps as 'deluxe' as were expecting. Having said that we were very happy with our choice of hotel overall, it was comfortable, the staff were friendly and was quiet. We particulary enjoyed the breakfast in the restaurant- one of the nicest we had the whole holiday.

Reviews.Title: “I expected more”
Reviews.Author: LondonPenguinGirl
Reviews.Content: I was really excited at staying here because of all the great reviews on tripadvisor. There are some great points about the hotel, mainly it is in a fantastic location, it is walking distance to almost all places we wanted to go to; we asked for some champagne glasses brought up and this was done quickly, and also we were given bottles of water and the newspaper every day. There is also free wireless internet access in the rooms. On the downside, the beds are SO soft, we woke up every morning with backache. To the hotel's credit, when we told them about this they added some boards under the mattresses, but the beds are still too soft. When we checked in, no one offered to take our bags up to our rooms. Their manner was fine, but not particularly friendly. They do not provide toothpaste or toothbrushes in the bathroom. There is insufficient wardrobe and and drawer space. The front desk does not carry any adaptors, and there are not enough power outlets in the room. All in all, the hotel is fine / good, but not the amazing experience that I was expecting.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Great Service. Would Happily Go Back.”
Reviews.Author: Palisor
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I wanted to celebrate our anniversary downtown by taking in a show and spending the night in a nice hotel. The Hotel at Terminal City Club was perfect. I would like to give a personal thank you to the Front Office Manager Michael Morris for all his help. I had booked a suite, which was lovely, but unfortunately it looked out onto a great deal of construction that is currently happening downtown. I went back down to the lobby and spoke to Michael. Without any fuss he happily moved me to a different suite, and went up with me to make sure it was to my liking. You really can't go wrong here. I had asked for some wine glasses to be brought to the room for the evening, and this was done within minutes of being checked in. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone. You might pay a bit more, but the money is well spent.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location for leisure and shopping”
Reviews.Author: newtraveller99
Reviews.Content: Location was my main priority when looking for a hotel in vancouver and i'm happy to report that the terminal city was perfect, i like to walk and explore new cities and the location was superb not only to all the main shopping streets and malls but also the near by Stanley park which is an atttraction in itself, great for a bike ride or visiting the aquarium. subway station 2 minute walk away nearby the olympic torch and various coffee shops. the hotel was faultless - i opted for a corner suite king and had expected a 2 room suite but wasn't dissdappointed to find only 1 room as it was very spacious and had a fantastic view of the river and city sktline, some nice touches also - newspaper at my door every morning before breakfast, numerous in house dining options and a very helpful front desk, even accepting deliveries from fed-ex and having it delivered to my room when i was out. very clean and well appointed room with a mini kitchen restocked with bottled water and various teas every day, the gym and swimming pool looked amazing also though i didn't get around to using it.

Reviews.Title: “Now THIS is the place to stay in Vancouver!!”
Reviews.Author: PaulTheTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: Wow. I love this hotel. This is my second visit here, and I am even more impressed than my first stay. Terminal City Club is a private club that offers a hotel. Very nice lobby and building. My room was simply amazing! A huge living room with comfortable furniture, bar area w/ sink and microwave, and a private bedroom with nice bathroom. Floor-to-ceiling windows make this stay an incredible one. Shocking views of the city, water, mountains. Great location within walking distance of everything in downtown Vancouver. While business travel is very much overrated, I simply can't wait to return to this hotel. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Much over-rated; poor service”
Reviews.Author: arf68
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations of this hotel based on the reviews here. I spend about 75 + nights a year in hotel rooms so have a good comparison base. The room we had was decent though nothing fancy, but we had no real complaints about that. The check-in process was poor and the initial welcome was not acceptable (someone who may have been the manager was at the reception desk doing something on a computer, did not look up when we came to the desk but only grumped at us that someone would be along to check us in--not very welcoming). We arrived in the morning and were fully expecting to be asked to check our bags and come back later: no issue with that. We were told that the room would be ready by 2:00 at the latest (check-in time is 3:00). We came back at 3:45 and were told that no room was ready and to take a seat. We then noticed that a couple of other groups were sitting around waiting. They did find us a room after a 15 minute wait, but there was no apology or basic friendliness. Surprising from a top-rated hotel. On check-out, we again had an indifferent front-desk clerk, who then got quite huffed at me when I expressed surprise that they did not accept debit cards (in Canada, a debit card is a bank card to make a withdrawal directly from your account, and there are really almost no businesses that do not accept them as Canadians love this kind of transaction). I didn't get thanked for my patronage and again felt quite unwelcome. Another negative: the reception desk is almost 100 yards from the front door (up a set of stairs), so when you come in you an head right to the elevators with no one having any oversight. There is a security guard behind a desk, but he seemed to never look up when we came in and there seemed to be no way for him to know who was and who was not a legitimate guest--pretty easy to get onto the hotel floors, so I think security is a big weak point in this hotel. A plus: the location is good. We chose this hotel over our regular one (3-4 stays a year--the Cascadia Hotel Vancouver) because we were working at a nearby location for three days. We had hoped that the hotel would be good as will be back another 3-4 times this year in the same location. As we will be bringing 30 + others with us each time, we thought it might be nice to do a recon on the TC Hotel. If they couldn't treat us with respect, why should we bring them a decent amount of business on a regular basis? We'll instead go back to the hotel we know, despite the inconvenience of the location for our purposes (staff are wonderful at the Cascadia, which keeps us coming back over and over), and put our people in one of the other very good hotels close to the TC Hotel (Pan Pacific, Delta, or Fairmont Waterfront, for example).

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: bwick22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night while visiting Vancouver for a concert. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was clean with a very comfortable bed, and nice touches like a full ice bucket, water and chocolates. The bar which I believe is part of the club was elegant, with tremendous selection and the best prices in Downtown. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience for our wedding and out of town guests!”
Reviews.Author: NewlyNelson
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel! We had such a great experience with this hotel, beginning long before we actually checked in. We got married at the Terminal City Club on September 19th, 2009 and had a lot of out of town guests coming to stay. I dealt with Kelly in reservations to make sure all our extended family and friends got booked in and she was fantastic. She made sure everyone was booked in at a reduced “wedding rate” and was always quick to respond to any questions I had. I stayed in a suite the night before my wedding with a girlfriend and then the night of our wedding. The room was beautiful, clean and very spacious. The bedroom and bathroom were gorgeous and the bed was so incredibly comfortable! The main area of the room had a great big L-shaped couch and a dining table/area that was perfect for all my bridesmaids to get ready in before the wedding. I was worried about having everyone fit into one hotel room, but we had more than enough space. When we came up to the room after our wedding, the staff had decorated with rose petals and left us champagne and the cutest chocolate covered strawberries made to look like tuxedos. We had a great night and were given a late check out without us even having to ask for one. The location of the hotel is perfect for Vancouver, right downtown by all the good shopping and things to see in Yaletown and Gastown. There are tons of excellent restaurants nearby as well. I live in Vancouver so don’t know how many chances I’ll get to go back to this hotel, but I would definitely recommend it and would jump at the chance for another stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Best place we stayed in Canada”
Reviews.Author: msprichj
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel we stayed at whilst travelling around Alberta and BC. I think we got lucky and had the best room for about £100 a night: it was on the 12th floor (top floor for the hotel bit) and looked out across the harbour. The bed was big, the room spacious and clean, and the facilities (including microwave and fridge) were excellent. Initially not sure where to park (it's behind the hotel where you see a green sign pointing to the underground public car park!), and had to pay for parking, but it IS downtown Vancouver! A block back from the harbour, the hotel is right in the heart of everything with Gastown and Chinatown being just a short walk. The best feature though is their 25m pool on the third floor overlooking the harbour: stunning! As is typical of these sorts of establishments, on-site dining/drinking was pricey, but with so many economical choices on your doorstep, you've no reason to actually eat at the hotel. Definitely recommend this place

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Great Location”
Reviews.Author: texasinsc
Reviews.Content: We had a two night pre-cruise stay and were given a free upgrade to a suite overlooking the waterfront. great accomodations and impecable service. Staff was friendly courteous and extremely helpful. Hotel is one block from Canada Center the main waterfront location. easy walk to trolley service for city tours and on your own exploration. The grill and outside dining at the hotel was convenient and very good food. Other restaraunts and coffee shop close by. Two blocks from Gas town.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Brollywood
Reviews.Content: We wanted a quiet, comfortable hotel close to a nice area, with a pool. This hotel is only about a block fromthe waterfront, and 50 metres from Howe St, with classy shops. Pool is beautiful with a view over the harbour to the mountains. Easy to get to Gastown, Chinatown, Stanley Park, numerous cafes and bars. Feels like a brand new hotel, but has retained all the aspects of the 100-year-old club. We didn't eat there so can't comment on the restaurants or room service.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: barbarasa
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Terminal City Club Tower Hotel in August and we could not have had a better experience. We booked our room through Hotwire (so the rate was terrific), but we expected to be given a small, no-view sort of a room. Instead we had a beautiful, large king-bed room, with a great view of city and harbor. The hotel staff were consistently helpful and accommodating. The amenities were also top notch. We very much appreciated the bucket of ice and water, delivered to the room each afternoon. We also enjoyed the pool, which has one of the best views in Vancouver, as well as the excellent sauna/steam room facilities. This is a marvelous hotel!

Reviews.Title: “convient for cruise terminal”
Reviews.Author: annbobSouthampton
Reviews.Content: Great place and just a few minutes walk from the cruise terminal.The hotel is wonderful, clean rooms and received a friendly greeting the minute you walked through the door. we did not use any of the facilities offered. We took the shuttle from the airport and you are only a couple of minutes from drop off to the hotel. Gas town and lots of eating places are just a few minutes walk from the hotel.Very convenient for tourists. We would definately stay here again and would highly recommend this hotel. Great place

Reviews.Title: “Great location and rooms”
Reviews.Author: jk2007
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Terminal City Tower Hotel. We booked through Hotwire, and it was a great deal. The location was very nice.....very close to the Canada Place dock and also to Gastown, where we ate at couple of nights....I would recommend Guu with Otokomae in Gastown for fun atmosphere and great Japanese tapas. Also lots of tourist/souvenir shops there and the 'steam clock'. It was a short walk to the Pacific Center mall, Vancouver Art Gallery and shopping on Robson street. The hotel was very classy. There were only 10-12 rooms per floor. For the most part, the hotel was very quiet. One night the room next to us was very loud, but I only heard them when they were in the hallway. As soon as their door was shut it was silent. The room was very large and plush. The bed and pillows were very comfortable---the floor to ceiling windows were great, and we had a very nice view of the city. I slept very well each night. The decor was stylish and the bedding was very nice. The kitchenette was handy and we used the mini-fridge and the microwave. We had plenty of coffee and tea to pick from in the room. The bathroom toiletries were also very nice. The bathroom wasn't huge, but was plenty for us. The free wireless internet was also a plus, although I was a bit wary of the internet security. I also liked getting free bottled water and chocolates each day. The 'club' pool and hot tub were also very pleasant. It was very quiet and clean and had windows with great views. The pool was setup mostly for lap swimming (not really for kids) and had pool 'exercise' equipment you could use (kickboards, etc). The pool was treated with ozone, so there wasn't a strong chlorine smell (although I think the hot tub had chlorine...) The locker area was very classy and the sauna and steam room seemed nice, although we didn't us them. They had towels to use and the front desk was very friendly. My only complaint was that the pool/fitness area closed at 10 pm. The other minor complaint I have is that some of the front desk staff seemed a bit snooty. One guy was very friendly and helpful, but another was not. The security staff did watch our luggage when we checked in at 11 am before our room was ready, which allowed us to explore for a while. Overall the location, decor, comfort of the beds, views and pool make this place great. I would recommend it to those looking for a quiet, classy place to stay downtown close to Gastown, Canada Place and other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “stunning hotel”
Reviews.Author: MargaretM1
Reviews.Content: We had to cancel our booking of 2 nights as we were returning to UK following a family bereavement .They gave us a full refund ! Now thats service ! We were able to alter our changed schedule and stay our last night here ,booking at last minute . Our 9th floor room was dual aspect ,modern ,comfortable and we were delighted to use it for just one night and disappointed that we had no time to try out all the fabulous facilities and restaurants . Lovely fluffy robes ,towels ,iron and board ,even an umbrella . The kitchenette had a microwave ,fridge and a few basics to put together a simple meal. We hope to return to Vancouver sometime and will definately book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find, Great Style!”
Reviews.Author: gypsybaker
Reviews.Content: After much searching and price comparison, I reserved a room for Sat. nite before my Sun. cruise. The deal I got thru hotels.com was actually only a few $ more than the Days Inn!! This does have a "downtown private club" feel to it and the staff seems very bright and professional (even got a very upbeat reply to the email I sent to confirm my rez. --I brought her some homemade white choc./lime cookies from FL. I hope the desk staff passed them on to her...I gave them some as well!) The room overlooked the financial district and if you looked just so, you could see the CA Place Pier and 1 of the ships docked there). Room service was fairly good (burger, fries, glass of wine) and very personable waitstaff!! I had planned to eat on the terrace at The Grill (private to guests & members) but felt to jetlaged I opted for my room instead. Very nice bed, soft sheets (a real plus!), pillows just right. Had a nice soak in the tub!! Explored the fitness center, lap pool (someone was getting a swimming lesson) and the hot tub looked inviting (again, too jet lagged even for that!) and there was an outdoor patio with chairs for sunning or just looking at the downtown skyscrapers (many of which were the most interesting I've ever seen). Staff was more than willing to check my luggage for me in the morning while I explored the area. You must go to Cafe Artigiano just down the street and even better, just around the corner from the hotel, is MINK - A Chocolate Cafe...which has the most amazing half dark, half lt. chocolate hot chocolate drink...ask them to spice it up (I think they call this Minkizing it or something like that...phenominal! They also sell bon bons and I bought abt. 8 of their different 50 g. bars with fillings. I may have to mail order more! Already I'm thinking up excuses to stay at Terminal City Club again and explore Vancouver more than my recent trip allowed.

Reviews.Title: “What a classy little hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: BoywonderTo
Reviews.Content: This was a mix business/leisure trip and we pick Terminal City Club because of its proximity to the convention centre. It was a great choice as this is truly an amazing place to stay. Being a private club, it is quiet and has low traffic (unlike the two more expensive hotels closer to the convention centre). The suite we were in was spacious and very comfortable. I did not get a chance to use the health club/pool, but according to my partner it was stunning.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Dinah1004
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Terminal City Hotel for 8 nights in December and had a fantastic stay. The hotel staff were friendly, courteous and very helpful. Could find no fault with our room, which overlooked the city and harbour - great views. The rooms were spacious and comfortable with little touches making all the difference to our stay. Having bottles of water, chocolates and ice delivered in the afternoon were great touches to our enjoyment at staying at this hotel. The rooms were also very quiet at night which ensured a good night's sleep. The leisure facilities were also excellent with a great pool for individuals who actually enjoy swimming and not just messing about in the water. Another bonus was that there were no children to spoil the whole experience. Great location, close to the harbour, Skytrain, Stanley Park and shopping. Will have no hesitation in booking this hotel again should I have the opportunity to go back to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: Les-Tonus
Reviews.Content: great hotel - nicely situated in downtown Vancouver, close to the seawall, in the financial district, not far from Gastown. West Hastings St is very clean and nice, which is very different to East Hastings street which is pretty run down and where the homeless seem to have taken over. Rooms are clean and spacious with view of the financial district (great at night when all lit up). The BIG plus is the access to the private health club facilities : great pool, squash courts, gym etc. Outstanding, the kids loved the pool at the end of a day visiting beautiful BC! The hotel staff were generally very friendly and helpful, and were easy to deal with on the phone for reservations etc. This is obviously a nice hotel for business visitors to Vancouver, but for us it was a good base from which to visit Vancouver and the surrounding areas. Even parking was not a problem as the underground car park gives direct access to the hotel lobby. We didn't try the restaurant, which looked pretty good, but there are lots of cafés and restaurants in the surrounding streets (try breakfast at Scoozis Mediterannean eatery just around the corner on Howe St - delicious French toast & deep dish !).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, near cruise ship terminals”
Reviews.Author: YourConcierge
Reviews.Content: Please see my pictures to see what the rooms look like. This hotel is within walking distance to the cruise ship terminal and shopping areas. During our stay there was an underground fire in the city and most places lost their electricity. This hotel has its own generator so it was a great place to be. Other people were trying to get rooms there and we were glad to not have to worry. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. The rooms were clean and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: diggaa
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect hotel if you like space, comfort and peace and quiet. We had a one bedroom suite and although we'd only booked a city view our room was on the side of the hotel so we had a lovely sea view from the sitting room and the bedroom. Both rooms were spacious and very well furnished. The bed was very comfortable and even the sofa bed had a proper firm mattress. Bathroom was small but fine. We never heard a single noise from elsewhere in the hotel and the traffic noise was just a distant humm and not a bother. It is first and foremost a club so very posh and the reception staff can be a bit snooty but everyone was very efficient and the porter couldn't have been more helpful. The pool and fitness facilities are absolutely wonderful with glorious views. There is free internet access off the library. Housekeeping was very good. We never like to get up too early when on holiday and, by the time we'd had breakfast in the room, it was often after ten before we left the room but we were never disturbed and our room was always made up when we arrived back. Someone comes around every afternoon with bottled water and to fill up the ice bucket which is very convenient. The only small quibble would be that, although the suite had a small kitchen area there were no dishes or cutlery supplied when we first arrive. There was a note to say that if we wanted anything just to ring reception and they did bring dishes, etc. up as soon as we rang but it would be nicer if they were just there and you didn't have to ask. The hotel is perfectly situation - just up from the waterfront and within easy walking distance of Stanley Park, the city and Gastown. We enjoyed the Water Street Cafe in Gastown and Wild Rice which is worth going to for the food even though it is a bit of a seedy area. One thing that had worried us before we went to Vancouver was that several people had commented on the number of panhandlers on the streets and we thought it might not be safe to wander around at night. I must say that we never felt nervous. We were only approached a couple of times and Vancouver must have the politest beggers in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at The Terminal City Club Tower Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkMaria
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel before going on a cruise. This hotel is in great location, just a block from the ship terminal. We had a room with 2 very comfortable beds on the 10th floor with a beautiful view. The room was very clean and tastefully decorated. The concierge was friendly and very helpful with suggestions for bus tours and places to see in a short time. I would recommend it and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ralan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel prior to an Alaskan cruise in July. The location was great. A small shopping in across the street and there is a pedestrian walkway that runs to Stanley Park within a block of the hotel. THe are around the hotel is very interesting to walk in. There are asian themed restaurants and art galleries in the area. We ate an excellent chinese restaurant that was about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. The room was in very good condition. The room was very clean and the furniture was in very good condition. The room size was large. The hotel is about a $30 US cab fare from the airport. To the terminal the fare was about $15 US. (The Canada Place terminal is within walking distance, about a 5 minute walk.) Checkin and checkout went smoothly. The hotel staff was very freidnly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Ready for European Elegance?”
Reviews.Author: NotInKansasAnymore51
Reviews.Content: Our one night stay at Terminal City Club was quite pleasant mainly due to an 'eager to please' bell hop. His youth and energy were refreshing and charming. It was apparently clear that our happiness was of utmost importance to him. The next day he loaded our luggage up on his cart and walked us to the Canada Cruise Terminal making our registration and boarding our cruise seamless. (We would have never found our way alone.) The Club Restraunt was cold, stuffy and definitely lacking in charm next to the service we received at the hotel. Our hats off to this young man ... bravo for a job well done!

Reviews.Title: “A view to die for”
Reviews.Author: Doucet
Reviews.Content: The Terminal City is an old established Vancouver club, which has been reborn with the addition of a luxury tower incorporating up-scale condos, several floors of luxury hotel suites, and extensive recreational and spa facilities. It is a fabulous property -- just across the street from Canada Place and the major cruise port facilities. If you get a room with a harbour view, you'll be able to look down on moored cruise ships, and see float planes coming and going... and all of this with the skyline of North Vancouver and the Canadian Rockies in the background. We chose a junior suite facing the harbour. With a wall of glass, the view was exceptional. Otherwise, the room was fairly typical of what one would expect in this price range. The restaurants are very good, but the street level features a wide variety of excellent restaurants, so there is no need to feel confined to what is offered on site. Service was flawless, and especially gratifying at a property wherein the hotel is only one of several areas of service.

Reviews.Title: “I'll stay here next time”
Reviews.Author: JohnT.D.
Reviews.Content: This is not the best known hotel in Vancouver, but the facilities, staff and location are exceptional. Great room, excellent fitness centre and very attentive staff who are eager to please and go the extra mile. I found the price extremely reasonable given the going rate at comparable properties.

Reviews.Title: “My letter of thanks.”
Reviews.Author: Roshdean
Reviews.Content: MY STAY AT THE CLUB To the Hotel Manager, August 2006. I write to thank you and, if I may, through you, to thank all the staff and personnel at the Terminal City Club for your superb hospitality and service during my stay in Vancouver last week. This was my first visit to Canada, and so I'd like to say a special thank you to the Club for being such an outstanding ambassador for your City and Country! Names of staff particularly remember include Hiroko, who saw me through the wide range of breakfasts available to hotel guests each day: I systematically travelled to Hawaii, Tokyo, Scotland, and elsewhere around the world each morning without ever leaving the breakfast table. Melissa guided me at lunchtime, and I'd like to mention Melissa's young man who prepared that quite outstanding barbeque on Thursday evening --- it was the first time I had really tasted oyster! Nicholas was always a special delight at table, what a great personality, he made me feel most welcome and always entertained. Mike at the bar, whom I understand is famed locally by Members for never having a bad day, confided to me his secret: always to leave any troubles outside and pick them up only when leaving the premises. Excellent advice. And Mike introduced me to a full bodied red for which I was most grateful, the wine reflected the warm and personable - distinguished - nature of the Club itself. But everyone at the Club really was outstandingly helpful and I can't praise everyone enough. Mine was too short a week, on business, but the weather was good and I was able to spend quality thinking time after work walking to and from Stanley Park. At 6am each day I was in the Club pool. What a great facility. I remember the softness of the green towels; the weighing scales that lied a little more each mooring, and the wide array of cleansing lotions --- all of them magically topped up themselves as new! On my last day, Mike asked if had any constructive criticisms to make about the Club. I was glowing and not the one to ask. I have been racking my brains to find something positive to contribute in this respect. But, so far, I have not come up with anything other than praise and thanks. My only advice is: just keep doing what you do. I hope to return to Vancouver on business, but, alas, probably not until next year. Next time I shall certainly add a few extra days for leisure at the Hotel and bring my wife who sadly was not able to join me this time round. I shall of course book in again, if I may. It's the only place in town. Please tell everyone you have a number-one fan over here in Oxford. I've been telling everyone about the TC Club Hotel in Vancouver! That very special atmosphere you all promote so gently, and so naturally, was much appreciated and makes all the difference. Thank you. Thank everyone. Paul Humphreys

Reviews.Title: “Overrated for the price”
Reviews.Author: RoadGypsy
Reviews.Content: Interesting how different experiences can be! I just stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and was extremely disappointed after reading other reviews. My husband and I stayed in an executive suite with beautiful harbor views, and it was a great base location for exploring the city. This is an older hotel and as expected the décor and room amenities reflect same. I.E. the furniture is quality but aged, there was water damage on the walls near the shower, there are no vending machine areas, etc. The biggest problem was the staff. I found them to be unfriendly and unhelpful. On arriving, the bell-hop didn’t even offer to take our bags up to the room! There was seldom anyone at the front door, and the concierge seemed to be at her desk only a few hours a day. When attempting to ask the front-desk staff for any information (I.E. locations, directions or other recommendations) the responses tended to be terse and vague. When calling down to ask a question about a local theater the response was “Oh, I wouldn’t no about that. Look it up in the phone book.” Basically, you are treated as if you should already know where everything is. I’ve never stayed at a hotel that didn’t even have local maps available to assist you with exploring the area. The workout center is nice and the staff there was far more helpful. The exercise equipment is fairly standard, but the locker rooms, pool and sauna/steam rooms are exceptional. Overall I’d say this is an overpriced hotel that puts all of its energy into catering to its club members, residents and event guests. Be prepared to pay just for the location … and extra for the views.

Reviews.Title: “Fitness club adds incredible value”
Reviews.Author: cpdh
Reviews.Content: We've just spent four very happy nights at the Terminal City Club Tower Hotel, and it's our pick already for a return trip. What we liked most about the hotel is the fitness club. In fact, we didn't use most of the fitness facilities, but we found we pretty much had the 25 meter pool to ourselves whenever we wanted. And be advised that it is a real 25 meter pool with four lanes - not some short little hotel pool in which one cannot really do laps. The club facilities include well-stocked locker rooms. One funny thing that resulted from using the club so much is that we used the hotel room shower only once! The room itself was not all that large, but large enough. The king sized bed was comfortable and outfitted with good linens. If you can, get a package that also includes breakfast. There are several menu options including a la carte dining, so you're likely to have a good meal. The hotel is in what is mostly a financial district, but the waterfront is a block away, Gastown is a short stroll, and it's not unreasonable to walk to most places in downtown Vancouver. All in all, the hotel is a quiet place that emanates a feeling of history, tradition, and prestige. Countering that is the friendliness of the staff. The pool alone draws us back, but the hotel was otherwise comfortable enough for us to return to.

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver's best kept secret”
Reviews.Author: lil_amsterdam
Reviews.Content: I've staying at this hotel a couple times in the past 2 years - most recently for NYE 2005. The hotel rooms are always beautiful, immaculately clean, w/ luxurious linens & furnishings. The entrance is all marble & ornate, & the support staff are always courteous & helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If your NOT looking for the best value in Vancouver.........”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If your NOT looking for the best value in Vancouver, then you probably want to stay elsewhere. We stayed in Vancouver before the start of our Alaska cruise with a group of friends, and what a way to start our holiday. The others in our group were scattered throughout the city at the other "5-Star" hotels and they all wished they were staying at Terminal City. The location is perfect for sight-seeing and boarding your cruise at Canada Place, which is across the street. (the bellman actually walked our luggage over to the terminal!!)The hotel offers ammenities such as a first class gym, large indoor pool, patio cafe, Pub, clean modern rooms and a friendly staff. All of this at a peak rate $$less than the others!! The standard rooms may be a bit small for some, but considering the over-all experiance this was not an issue for us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: marikim
Reviews.Content: Terninal city hotel was a perfect way to end the cruise. After being in a small room the our kids we splurged for the largest suite. The room was gorgeous with first class amenities and comfortable beds. The views (it was a corner) offered floor to ceiling windows of the mountains and the sea. The club was fun although it closed too early. The pool is the largest and the hottub a great way to unwind. It was walking distance from everything and we had an ethnic dinner at Hons (very traditional cafeteria style Asian cuisine in a fun atmosphere) and went to Gastown to a funky new-age pizza and american cuisine on the water called Incendio...a 5! (great artwork too!)

Reviews.Title: “Good "stay", but....one problem later”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in July 04 and the Hotel itself was excellent because it's non smoking facility (entire building), nice room, cool lookin' gym and pool with view of mountains, and super convenient location. Onsite stuff was also very nice. However, I had unexpected trouble with the Hotel a month later.... There was a wrong charge appeared on my credit card from the Hotel and the customer service on that regard was pretty poor. So, I had to dispute it to the card company after all. It is very disappointed especially because the hotel stay itself was good.

Reviews.Title: “best kept secret”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Terminal City Club Tower is the best kept secret in Vancouver. We just returned for a 3 night stay - outstanding accomodations...great location (one block from Canada Place)...tremendous staff. Very quiet, with excellent workout facilities as part of the private membership club. Truly hate to share our secret.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the family!!!”
Reviews.Author: scubadrj
Reviews.Content: Our Family stayed here for 8 days in the summer of 2004. The accomidations were outstanding. We stayed in a large 1 bedroom suite with a nice view of the city. The pool is indoor though as it is completely coverred with glass you feel as if you are outside with a great view of the water and the mountains. The hotel is located just infont of Canada place and is a 15 minute walk to Stanley park.

HotelInfo.Name: The Hotel at Terminal City Club
HotelInfo.Address: 837 West Hastings Street, Vancouver, British Columbia V6C 1B6 , Canada
